intro: Galium erectum, commonly known as bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in summer, followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium erectum is known for its medicinal uses and has been traditionally used in herbal remedies.
